Class Driver

java.lang.Object
Driver
public class Driver extends Object
Driver class for processing movie records and navigating through them. This class contains methods for processing input files, serializing and deserializing movie records, displaying menus, and navigating through movie arrays.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws FileNotFoundException
      Main method for running the movie database application.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments (not used in this application).
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If a file is not found.

    • do_part1

      public static String do_part1(String part1, String[] genres)
      Processes part 1 of the assignment, which involves reading input files, validating records, and writing valid and invalid records to separate files.
      Parameters:
      part1 - Path to the input manifest file for part 1.
      genres - Array of genres used for validation.
      Returns:
      The path to the output manifest file for part 2.

    • splitLine

      public static String[] splitLine(String line) throws ExcessFieldsException, MissingQuotesException, MissingFieldsException, MissingFieldsException
      Splits a line of text into fields based on comma separators, handling quoted fields properly.
      Parameters:
      line - The input line to be split.
      Returns:
      An array of fields extracted from the input line.
      Throws:
      ExcessFieldsException - If more than 10 fields are found in the input line.
      MissingQuotesException - If there are missing quotes in a quoted field.
      MissingFieldsException - If fewer than 10 fields are found in the input line.

    • processMovieRecord

      public static void processMovieRecord(String line, String[] genres, String inputFile, int lineNumber) throws BadYearException, BadTitleException, BadDurationException, BadGenreException, BadRatingException, BadScoreException, BadNameException, ExcessFieldsException, MissingFieldsException, MissingQuotesException
      Processes a movie record, validates its fields, and writes it to the corresponding genre file.
      Parameters:
      line - The input line representing a movie record.
      genres - An array of valid genres.
      inputFile - The name of the input file being processed.
      lineNumber - The line number of the movie record within the input file.
      Throws:
      BadYearException - If the year field is invalid.
      BadTitleException - If the title field is missing.
      BadDurationException - If the duration field is invalid.
      BadGenreException - If the genre field is invalid.
      BadRatingException - If the rating field is invalid.
      BadScoreException - If the score field is invalid.
      BadNameException - If any of the name fields are missing.
      ExcessFieldsException - If more than 10 fields are found in the input line.
      MissingFieldsException - If fewer than 10 fields are found in the input line.
      MissingQuotesException - If there are missing quotes in a quoted field.

    • sortGenre

      public static void sortGenre(String part2, String[] genres) throws FileNotFoundException, MissingFieldsException, MissingQuotesException, ExcessFieldsException
      Sorts good movie records into separate genre files based on their genre.
      Parameters:
      part2 - The name of the input manifest file for part 2.
      genres - An array of valid genres.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If the input file containing good movie records is not found.
      MissingFieldsException - If fewer than 10 fields are found in a movie record.
      MissingQuotesException - If there are missing quotes in a quoted field.
      ExcessFieldsException - If more than 10 fields are found in a movie record.

    • do_part2

      public static String do_part2(String part2)
      Reads CSV files containing good movie records, serializes them, and creates a manifest file for part 3.
      Parameters:
      part2 - The name of the input manifest file for part 2.
      Returns:
      The path of the output manifest file for part 3.

    • do_part3

      public static Movie[][] do_part3(String part3, String[] genres)
      Reads serialized movie data, deserializes it, and returns a 2D array of Movie objects.
      Parameters:
      part3 - The name of the input manifest file for part 3.
      genres - An array of valid genres.
      Returns:
      A 2D array containing Movie objects grouped by genre.

    • displayMainMenu

      public static void displayMainMenu(Scanner scanner, Movie[][] moviesArr, String[] genres, int choice)
      Displays the main menu for the movie database application.
      Parameters:
      scanner - Scanner object for user input.
      moviesArr - 2D array containing movie records.
      genres - Array of genres.
      choice - Index of the selected genre.

      scanner - Scanner object for user input.
      moviesArr - 2D array containing movie records.
      genres - Array of genres.

    • movieNavigation

      public static void movieNavigation(Scanner scanner, Movie[][] moviesArr, String[] genres, int choice, int currentPosition)
      Handles movie navigation based on user input.
      Parameters:
      scanner - Scanner object for user input.
      moviesArr - 2D array containing movie records.
      genres - Array of genres.
      choice - Index of the selected genre.
      currentPosition - Current position within the movie array.

    • navigateMovies

      public static void navigateMovies(int n, Movie[] movies, int choice, Scanner scanner, Movie[][] moviesArr, String[] genres, int currentPosition)
      Navigates through movie records based on user input.
      Parameters:
      n - Number of records to navigate.
      movies - Array of Movie objects.
      choice - Index of the selected genre.
      scanner - Scanner object for user input.
      moviesArr - 2D array containing movie records.
      genres - Array of genres.
      currentPosition - Current position within the movie array.
